description.latex: Collaborated with MFCNS, scholarship fund director, and the Cornell Alumni Association for the 2009--2010 annual research project, Academic Integrity, culminating with group presentation and discussion with relevant Cornell faculty and professors.

description: Constructed an autonomous plane with capabilities to navigate waypoints, survey areas, and retrieve visual information about the surfaces below as part of a team effort for AUVSI's (Association for Unmanned Vehicle Systems International) Student Unmanned Air Systems Competition.
Verified a model that characterizes the conductivity of annealed Strontium Titanate samples.
Further investigated conductivity behavior of annealed Strontium Titanate samples under varying electric potentials.

title.latex: Synchrotron Radiation Focusing Optics --- Capillary Beam Stop Design

description: Designed a beam stop assembly to eliminate parasitic X-Ray beams and improve focusing capabilities of the ellipsoidal glass capillary optic.

pulsed_laser_simulation.title: Plume Propagation Simulation for Pulsed Laser Deposition
description: Developed a three-dimensional Monte-Carlo simulation of the Pulsed Laser Deposition material growth technique used at the Cornell High Energy Synchrotron Source.

materials_cartography.title: Materials Cartography
description: Developed novel fingerprinting method for electronic properties of materials that enabled the construction of similarity maps.
Collaborative effort between UNC-Chapel Hill and Duke University.

pocc.title: Modeling Off-Stochiometry Materials
description: Developed and implemented a robust framework for modeling off-stoichiometry and aperiodic materials in a high-throughput fashion.
Collaborative effort between UCSD and Duke University.

phd_thesis.title: Advanced Techniques in High-Throughput Computational Materials Science
